1.title_api: Martin Brodeur returns to Devils in business role
1.desc_api: Martin Brodeur returns to Devils in business role
1.caption_api: FILE - In this June 9, 2003, file photo, New Jersey Devils goalie Martin Brodeur celebrates with the Stanley Cup after defeating the Anaheim Mighty Ducks in Game 7 in East Rutherford, N.J. Brodeur is returning to the New Jersey Devils as executive vice president of business development. Brodeur is back with the franchise he led to the Stanley Cup three times and became the NHL‚Äôs all-time-leading goaltender in victories. The 46-year-old shifts to the business side after three years in hockey management as assistant general manager of the St. Louis Blues. The Devils announced Brodeur‚Äôs hire Wednesday, Aug. 29, 2018, not long after the Blues said he left the organization. (AP Photo/Charles Krupa, File)

11.title_api: Alabama’s reign causes SEC foes to lose patience in coaches
11.desc_api: Alabama’s reign causes SEC foes to lose patience in coaches
11.caption_api: FILE - From left are 2018 file photos showing NCAA college football head coaches, Mississippi State’s Joe Moorhead, Tennessee’s Jeremy Pruitt, Arkansas’ Chad Morris, Florida’s Dan Mullen and Texas A&M’s Jimbo Fisher.¬†The decade-long chase to catch Alabama has caused patience to wear thin across the rest of the Southeastern Conference. As Nick Saban and Alabama chase their sixth national title in 10 seasons this year, five of the SEC‚Äôs other 13 programs have new coaches. It represents the league‚Äôs highest turnover since 1946, when the SEC had six new coaches. (AP Photo/File)

23.title_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats edge Edmonton Eskimos on final-play field goal
23.desc_api: Jeremiah Masoli threw for a whopping 419 yards and the Tiger-Cats, after being plagued by early mistakes, scored the last 15 points to win the kind of games that have often slipped away from them this season.
23.caption_api: Ticats’ Luke Tasker shakes Edmonton players as he heads to the end zone for a touchdown to bring the game to withing two points at 24-22. A last-second field goal would tip the game in the Ticats’ favour.

29.caption_api: FILE - In this Aug. 22, 2018, file photo, Ohio State football coach Urban Meyer makes a statement during a news conference in Columbus, Ohio. Meyer‚Äôs current suspension and previous paid leave have restricted him from talking football with his staff and athletes during August with one exception _ a team meeting the day after the suspension was announced. 35.title_api: Blue Bombers, Tiger-Cats get into head games
35.desc_api: Between Winnipeg coach Michael O’Shea and his penchant for special teams strategems and Hamilton coach June Jones’ run-and-shoot attack, each team has a lot to think about going into Friday night’s CFL showdown.
35.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats head coach June Jones fully expects the Winnipeg Blue Bombers, who are coming off of a bye week, “to do some funny things” on Friday.

37.title_api: How seven Hamilton Tiger-Cats defensive backs became housemates
37.desc_api: After rookie defensive back Jackson Bennett found a place after training camp, teammates scrambling for accommodation all ended up living under the same Cannon Street roof.
37.caption_api: Seven Ticats defensive backs — from left to right, John Green, Jackson Bennett, Richard Leonard, Mariel Cooper, Frankie Williams, Jumal Rolle and Cariel Brooks — have rented a house together this season.

38.title_api: Second-chance Jalen Saunders on record-setting pace with Ticats
38.desc_api: The words come spilling out in a torrent, thoughts and ideas and emotions piled upon one another. He expresses the things that matter most — the challenges, the failures, the ultimate resurrection of his career with the Hamilton Tiger-Cats — with an uncommon intensity, with the perspective that comes from living with and learning from life’s mistakes.
38.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger Cats Jalen Saunders pulls down the ball in first quarter action on July 19, 2018.
